item.title: Cloud-Only Testing: Convenience vs Risk
item.author: diegojromerolopez@gmail.com (Diego J. Romero-López)
item.description: Cloud-Only Testing: Convenience vs Risk The cloud did not removed complexity, it only centralized it. The infrastructure became more programmable, flexible, scalable, and abstracted. But that did not mean that the systems became simpler. Architecting for the cloud The cloud companies were born as a way to reduce complexity for the engineering teams. However, the complexity was not removed, but moved from the engineering teams to the cloud systems. But creating complex architectures in the cloud has a clear counterpart: how can we ensure they work properly?
